channel.title: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP) :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Authenticate with an external identity provider (IdP) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 198 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: The first two sections of the source document are being used in Learn > OIDC > Identity Providers (ID: 784) so this doc starts at “How Okta connects to external IdPs” but requires a new introduction to this group of documents as a whole.

item.title: Add a social IdP
item.description: Add a social IdP Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 281 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: no changes needed to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Links to original docs: Social Login: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/social-login/amazon/main/ Page type: Task Content type: How-to without code A “How-to without code” illustrates how to perform a specific task that does not rely on writing code.

item.title: Add an enterprise IdP
item.description: Add an enterprise IdP Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 282 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: What is an “Enterprise” IdP. We need to define it and understand whether this is the best way to split up IdPs. Changes to be made:

item.title: Add the Login.gov IdP
item.description: Add the Login.gov IdP Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 280 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Add an explanation of why this guide is separate from the other two IdP guides. Is it because the guides in this section are split up into IdP types?
